title: Iran's crackdown reaches unprecedented levels: 'There were layers of bodies stacked on top of each other'
subhed: Point-blank shootings at protests, hangars filled with corpses and omnipresent security forces: Multiple accounts gathered by Le Monde attest to the unparalleled violence used by authorities to suppress the demonstrations.

title: France to send troops to Greenland for joint exercise with several European countries
Zelensky to declare 'state of emergency' in Ukraine's energy sector
US suspends immigrant visa procedures for nationals of 75 countries
subhed: According to Fox News, the measure is set to affect citizens of Somalia, Russia, Afghanistan, Brazil, Iran, Iraq, Egypt, Nigeria, Thailand and Yemen, among others, but does not affect tourist, business or other visas.

title: South Korean prosecutors seek death penalty for Yoon Suk Yeol over martial law declaration
subhed: Prosecutors argued that the former conservative South Korean president was guilty of leading an insurrection 'in order to remain in power by usurping judicial and legislative authority.' The verdict is expected on February 19.

title: 'In the face of Donald Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
subhed: As the president shows his eagerness to dismantle any form of checks and balances both within and beyond the US borders, the principles of law paradoxically endure, explains Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhed: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: Astronauts from the Crew-11 space mission leave the ISS

French Assemblée Nationale rejects no-confidence motions filed by LFI and RN in protest against free trade treaty
Venezuela's interim president announces 'new political era'
US-backed plan to end war in Gaza moves into second phase
Russia steps up Ukraine strikes as polar cold grips the country
byline: By Emmanuel Grynszpan and Thomas d’Istria (Kyiv, correspondent)

title: Chiara Ferragni acquitted in charity cake and Easter egg fraud trial

EU says Ukraine will spend most of €90 billion loan on military needs
Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
subhed: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
subhed: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaurès.

title: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
subhed: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

title: Trump's disastrous undermining of the Federal Reserve
'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
Quinn Slobodian: 'The US discarding the post-1945 international system is a bold and reckless gamble'
